author: Gamers Nexus
description:
Sponsor: HYTE X50 on Amazon (Glass) https://geni.us/CEBL (Air) https://geni.us/4xVhNo
In hardware news this week, we're recapping the Intel accidental Battlemage B770 confirmation or leak, talking about DRAM prices continuing to rise for SK Hynix and Samsung memory, NVIDIA sort of bringing back 32-Bit PhysX support, and more.

Sources doc: https://www.one-tab.com/page/F3ZgDl5pSTiJ6KkFScL9zg

The best way to support our work is through our store: https://store.gamersnexus.net/

Like our content? Please consider becoming our Patron to support us: http://www.patreon.com/gamersnexus

TIMESTAMPS

00:00 - Recap for the Week
01:31 - Quick GN Update: Major Videos Inbound
06:28 - Intel Name-Drops Battlemage B770
09:04 - SK Hynix Says Memory Supply Low to 2028
11:08 - NVIDIA 32-Bit PhysX Returning
13:31 - Huawei Ascend 950 GPU
16:53 - GODLIKE Price for GODLIKE Board
19:07 - Redstone Fake Frames via OptiScaler
20:49 - Right-to-Repair for Military Equipment Thwarted
24:37 - Samsung DRAM Skyrocket
title: HW News - Intel Battlemage B770 Leak, More Huawei GPUs Arrive, Memory Crisis Worsens
